author: John Cross
title: Chelsea plan Antonio Conte pay-rise and contract extension to fend off Inter Milan's £10m-a-year offer
text:
Antonio Conte speaks after Chelsea 3-1 Swansea City Share this video Watch Next 
Simeone could also be a target to be the next coach of his native Argentina's national team. 
Chelsea are ready to offer Conte a new, improved contract in the summer, as the former Italy and Juventus boss has worked wonders in his debut season. 
They are very confident they will be able to keep the former Italy midfielder, whose current deal, worth around £6.5m a year, expires in 2018. 
Blues chiefs know that his brilliant first season has marked him down as one of Europe’s top managers and plan to offer Conte a significant pay-rise and an extension in the length of his contract. Pioli has followed Roberto Mancini, Frank De Boer and Stefano Vecchi as Inter boss this season (Photo: Getty) 
He is understood to be happy in London, and any suggestions of problems at Stamford Bridge have been dismissed. 
* CHELSEA are set to resume discussions with goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois over a new deal in the summer when he will have two years left on his existing contract. 
Mirror Sport understands one reason the Blues have held off restarting talks with Belgium international Courtois is they wanted to make sure he wanted to stay first, avoiding a potentially protracted contract saga. Like us on Facebook
